chapter.title: Integrated help and package documentation
chapter.para: Virtualization packages provide commands for managing many aspects of a virtualization host. It is not possible or expected to remember all options supported by these commands. A basic installation of a &xen; or &kvm; host includes manual pages and integrated help for shell commands. The documentation sub-packages provide additional content beyond what is provided by the basic installation.

listitem.para: Most commands include a manual page that provides detailed information about the command, describes any options, and in certain cases gives example command usage. For example, to see the manual for the virt-install command type:
Commands also include integrated help, providing more compact and topic-driven documentation. For example, to see a brief description of the virt-install command type:
Integrated help can also be used to see the details of a specific option. For example, to see the sub-options supported by the disk option type:

Many of the virtualization packages provide additional content in their documentation sub-package. As an example, the libvirt-doc package contains all the documentation available at , plus sample code demonstrating the use of the libvirt C API.
